title: ISS urges Apple investors to vote against proposal to scrap diversity policies
description: (Reuters) -Proxy advisory firm Institutional Shareholder Services on Friday recommended that Apple (AAPL) shareholders vote against an investor proposal asking the tech giant to consider abolishing its diversity, equity and inclusion (DEI) policies.

title: People need to spend ‘more time fixing the climate’ than ‘getting into the metaverse’: iPod inventor
description: Former Apple (AAPL) engineer Tony Fadell — who's credited with inventing the iPod and helping design the iPhone — slammed the metaverse as a distraction from efforts to address existential problems in the physical world like climate change.

title: Microsoft ditches OpenAI board observer seat amid regulatory scrutiny
description: Microsoft (MSFT.O), opens new tab has ditched the board observer seat at OpenAI that has drawn regulatory scrutiny on both sides of the Atlantic, saying it was not necessary after the AI start-up’s governance had improved significantly in the past eight months.

title: OpenAI board in talks with Sam Altman to return as CEO - reports (NASDAQ:MSFT)
description: OpenAI is in discussions with Sam Altman to return as CEO after his ousting. Altman is ambivalent about returning and wants governance changes.

title: Breakdown: Net zero goals demand zero tolerance
description: What do Microsoft (MSFT.O), British Airways, Royal Dutch Shell (RDSa.L), and Glencore (GLEN.L) have in common? They all reckon their greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions will hit “net zero” by 2050. Though the targets sound the same, investors shouldn’t assume they are. Breakingviews offers a way to sort substance from hot air.

title: Farmers struggle to break into booming carbon-credit market

title: Tesla stock rises on increase in China-made deliveries
description: Tesla (TSLA) shares are trading in the green on news its price cuts in China may be working. Tesla's China-made EV deliveries were up 9.3 percent year-over-year, with a total of 84,159 vehicles sold in August, according to the Chinese Passenger Car Association. Yahoo Finance Live discusses what this means for the company.
